gui

Class AbstractRobotDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • gui.AbstractRobotDriver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RobotDriver
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Explorer, WallFollower, Wizard

    public abstract class AbstractRobotDriver
extends java.lang.Object
implements RobotDriver
    Author:
    Elijah Mas

    • Method Detail

      • setRobot

        public void setRobot(Robot r)
        Description copied from interface: RobotDriver
        Assigns a robot platform to the driver. The driver uses a robot to perform, this method provides it with this necessary information.
        Specified by:
        setRobot in interface RobotDriver
        Parameters:
        r - robot to operate

      • setDimensions

        public void setDimensions(int width,
                          int height)
        Description copied from interface: RobotDriver
        Provides the robot driver with information on the dimensions of the 2D maze measured in the number of cells in each direction.
        Specified by:
        setDimensions in interface RobotDriver
        Parameters:
        width - of the maze
        height - of the maze

      • setDistance

        public void setDistance(Distance distance)
        Description copied from interface: RobotDriver
        Provides the robot driver with information on the distance to the exit. Only some drivers such as the wizard rely on this information to find the exit.
        Specified by:
        setDistance in interface RobotDriver
        Parameters:
        distance - gives the length of path from current position to the exit.

      • triggerUpdateSensorInformation

        public void triggerUpdateSensorInformation()
        Description copied from interface: RobotDriver
        Tells the driver to check its robot for operational sensor. If one or more of the robot's distance sensor become operational again after a repair operation, this method allows to make the robot driver aware of this change and to bring its understanding of which sensors are operational up to date.
        Specified by:
        triggerUpdateSensorInformation in interface RobotDriver

      • drive2Exit

        public boolean drive2Exit()
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: RobotDriver
        Drives the robot towards the exit given it exists and given the robot's energy supply lasts long enough.
        Specified by:
        drive2Exit in interface RobotDriver
        Returns:
        true if driver successfully reaches the exit, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getEnergyConsumption

        public float getEnergyConsumption()
        Description copied from interface: RobotDriver
        Returns the total energy consumption of the journey, i.e., the difference between the robot's initial energy level at the starting position and its energy level at the exit position. This is used as a measure of efficiency for a robot driver.
        Specified by:
        getEnergyConsumption in interface RobotDriver

      • getPathLength

        public int getPathLength()
        Description copied from interface: RobotDriver
        Returns the total length of the journey in number of cells traversed. Being at the initial position counts as 0. This is used as a measure of efficiency for a robot driver.
        Specified by:
        getPathLength in interface RobotDriver

      • interrupt

        public void interrupt()
        Description copied from interface: RobotDriver
        Changes internal state of the driver to realize that the algorithm has been interrupted and should prematurely terminate. When interrupted, drive2Exit should return false. In order for this to have the intended effect, drive2Exit should be called within a thread separate from the main thread; otherwise this method has no effect.
        Specified by:
        interrupt in interface RobotDriver

      • getDistance

        protected java.lang.Integer getDistance(CardinalDirection cd)
        Get the distance in an absolute direction cd. Calls __getDistance__(cd) until a non-null result is returned.
        Parameters:
        cd - a CardinalDirection value
        Returns:
        distance in input direction

      • __getDistance__

        protected java.lang.Integer __getDistance__(CardinalDirection requested_cd)
        To get the distance to a wall in a given direction, figure out which of the robot's operational sensors is closest to that direction, rotate the robot so that this sensor faces the requested direction, and then take the distance measurement. There is a race condition: between the times when the operational sensor is identified and when the robot has rotated, that sensor may have failed. This possibility is handled by the while loop in getDistance.
        Parameters:
        requested_cd - CardinalDirection where distance is sought
        Returns:
        distance in direction if it can be retrieved, null otherwise

      • tryDistance

        java.lang.Integer tryDistance(Robot.Direction d)
        Try returning the distance to a wall in a given direction; if not possible, return null. Convenience method to wrap around Robot.distanceToObstacle(Direction).
        Parameters:
        d - a Robot.Direction value
        Returns:
        distance in d if obtainable, else null.

      • getClosestFunctionalSensor

        protected CardinalDirection getClosestFunctionalSensor(CardinalDirection cd)
        Get the CardinalDirection of the closest functional sensor from an input CardinalDirection.
        Parameters:
        cd - CardinalDirection value
        Returns:
        CardinalDirection of operational sensor closest to cd

      • moveRobot

        void moveRobot(CardinalDirection cd)
        Face the robot towards a given CardinalDirection, then move it in that direction by a single step.
        Parameters:
        cd - CardinalDirection value

      • faceRobot

        void faceRobot(CardinalDirection cd)
        Face the robot towards a given CardinalDirection
        Parameters:
        cd - CardinalDirection value

      • directionOfExit

        CardinalDirection directionOfExit()
        Get the Robot.Direction in which the robot can see the exit, if any; if the robot cannot see the exit, return null.
